intro: Hieracium lenkoranense, commonly known as the Lenkoran hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
